JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
We need you as our new Laboratory Manager

Controlled polymers A/S is a local company in Ribe, owned by Americhem. We have for more than 30 years worked with dyeing of plastic granules and fibers in all desired colors. We do not produce end products, but supply raw materials to, among others, the pharmaceutical industry, the automotive industry, and others.

We are searching for a laboratory Manager with R&D skills to a newly created position as the current responsible needs to focus more on other tasks and areas. At Controlled Polymers the key word is quality, and it is important for us that our products have the same high quality every time we produce it.

Job profile

As a Laboratory Manager you will be responsible for research and developing of our product as well as responsible for 16 colors technicians and quality controllers. You will be part of our management team.

Your tasks will be:

  • Manage the laboratory team
  • Responsible for daily quality inspections
  • Develop and optimize production methods
  • In cooperation with Purchase, select and approve suppliers of new raw materials
  • Be responsible for the equipment in the laboratory
  • Develop products in cooperation with customers
  • Participate in meeting with customers and suppliers
  • Support Sales through technical inquiries and new projects

Your profile

You are educated as chemical engineer, production engineer or similar and you have experience from a position where you have been manager for 3 - 5 employees and worked with R&D. It is important that you are quality-conscious, hard-working by nature and take ownership of your tasks. You can come up with new ideas and are happy to make suggestions for improvement. You have a good level of English and Danish in both writing and speaking as well as working with IT. It will be an advantage if you have knowledge of the plastics industry, colors, and injection molding, but it is not a requirement.

We offer

A challenging job in a dynamic and growth-oriented organization. The company is generally characterized by an informal tone combined with a high level of quality. We work for freedom under responsibility and as Controlled Polymers is in a positive development, there will be continuous improvements and efficiencies.

Information

If you have any question about the position, please contact Director, Technology & Operations, Rikke Maj Ager at rma@conpol.com or +452946 7514. Send your application today. Once we have found the right candidate, we will end the recruitment.

We do not produce end products, but supply raw materials to, among others, the pharmaceutical industry, the automotive industry, and others.
